name: Red-capped tamarin
description: The red-capped tamarin , is subspecies of moustached tamarin from South America. They are found in Brazil, on the eastern margin of the Tef√© and Coari rivers. Previously recognised as a separate species, Saguinus pilatus, the red-capped tamarin was demoted to subspecies status by a taxonomic review by Rylands et al., (2016).
